channel.title: Business Ideas
channel.description:
What are some good ideas for a business? Thanks.
EDIT: Legal ideas pl0x ;)

item.description:

item.title: Business Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:23, topic:428511”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=531203.msg3880688#msg3880688 date=1326009947]

I give the best advice anybody could give and no comments -.-

I’m not sure if the OP is 18+ or whatever the age restriction is for where they live. I’m 19, and I approve this idea.
[/quote]as far as I know the law just dictates ( in the U.S. at least) that you have to be 18 to watch it. It says nothing about “owning” it xD

I’m sure there’s more to it than that. Then again, there’s always loopholes.[/quote]well a business person doesn’t technically put the company solely in their name. It would be put in as a private owner. Meaning, unless you release that information nobody will know anyway.

…he just wouldn’t be able to apply for a business license. ( which isn’t really need for that type of business? )

Read full topic

item.title: Business Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:16, topic:428511”]I suggest you not get a job at a fast food restaurant… If you want to make some money why not give a state job like something in construction or maintenance a try? The good thing about that is, when the state is hiring you will be one of the first people to know since the state looks in house and then if they cannot find someone they will put it up for the public.

EDIT: if you want a fun job then do something you find fun… If you’re not that great at programming, then why not get a job you may not like as much but can still pay for classes in programming and such… Another idea would be to enlist into the military, you for one get paid, don’t have to buy really anything since almost everything is provided for you, plus they also pay for your education. :D[/quote]

Im going to university for 3 years to learn game programming but thats not for another 2 years.

Read full topic

item.title: Business Ideas
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

If I were you I’d post this in an entrepreneurial-type forum. Asking MoparScape for originality is like asking, well, I can’t come up with a decent analogy so oh well.

Add my Skype: SpecialAgentJackBower

Read full topic

item.title: Business Ideas
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“Pzezima2, post:15, topic:428511”][quote author=lemme_winks_ link=topic=531203.msg3880619#msg3880619 date=1326004757]

I enjoy programming, but i’m not good enough to make a game or even have a business.

then why are you considering making a business (assuming you are considering to make a business due to you asking for business ideas)?

to make money, duh.

i’d suggest either learning more about programming, make a simple game with a few buddies, and see where that goes, or go find a job at mcdonalds for some money.
[/quote]

i already have a job, i just want to have a fun job.[/quote]
you do realize in order to get a job like that you have plenty of experience and a history of hard work? btw, you answered your own question. good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Business Ideas
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I suggest you not get a job at a fast food restaurant… If you want to make some money why not give a state job like something in construction or maintenance a try? The good thing about that is, when the state is hiring you will be one of the first people to know since the state looks in house and then if they cannot find someone they will put it up for the public.

EDIT: if you want a fun job then do something you find fun… If you’re not that great at programming, then why not get a job you may not like as much but can still pay for classes in programming and such… Another idea would be to enlist into the military, you for one get paid, don’t have to buy really anything since almost everything is provided for you, plus they also pay for your education.

Read full topic
